repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection documents the day-to-day activities of the Historic Albany Foundation.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of administrative records including Board minutes, strategic planning documents, committee reports, and correspondence; subject files; studies, proposals and reports; event files; surveys; files about specific properties and deeds/real estate contracts; clips; and fundraising files.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Pam Howard of the Historic Albany Foundation donated all items in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in December 2024.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Historic Albany Foundation Records, 1975-2002. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Historic Albany Foundation Records).

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is currently unprocessed and is not yet arranged. Individual items may be difficult to find.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: The Historic Albany Foundation is a nonprofit organization that aims to preserve and protect buildings in the City of Albany that have architectural, historic, or civic value. Initially established in 1974 to advocate for the preservation of the Center Square and Hudson Park neighborhoods following two major construction projects in the city (Empire State Plaza and Interstate 787) which demolished a significant number of buildings, the organization today provides preservation advocacy, education, and technical assistance. The Foundation works with historic property owners, neighborhood stakeholders, private developers, elected officials and government agencies.
Since 1978, Foundation also has operated the Capital District's only nonprofit architectural salvage warehouse, stocking historic house parts that may be repurposed and reused.
